title: Virgin Media customers now get Amazon Prime for free - here's how
text:

Virgin Media is already famed for its super fast internet speeds, but now there's another incentive to chat about: its freebies.

As the TV and broadband provider has just announced that its giving its customers free twelve month Amazon Prime subscriptions, worth £79 , when they sign up to the service.

It's available to all new customers that pick up Virgin Media's Big, Bigger and Ultimate bundles, which start at £38 per month.

Just in time for Black Friday and Christmas, the full Prime subscription includes free one day delivery, Amazon Prime Video, Prime Music with over 2 million songs, and Prime Reading with unlimited access to thousands of books.

(Image: Getty Images Europe)

Football fans new to Virgin Media will also be able to watch 20 games of Premier League football for free in December when two rounds of fixtures come to the platform for the first time.

The move is all due to the fact that Amazon Prime Video is now fully integrated into the Virgin Media interface, so you can watch its shows and films directly through the V6 TV set top box, rather than having to cast them onto your telly like before.

You have until Wednesday 13th November to get yours from the Virgin Media website, with the Amazon Prime freebie available on all the following Virgin Media tariffs...

However, do be aware that the subscriptions do also involve a £35 set-up fee, so do be aware, plus the price will increase by a fair amount after the first twelve months.
description: Get Amazon Prime for free for a full 12 months as Virgin Media launch impressive freebie
